comment: Multiplicative property of the prime count pre-function. Note that the primality of ` P ` is essential for this property; ` ( 4 pCnt 2 ) = 0 ` but ` ( 4 pCnt ( 2 x. 2 ) ) = 1 =/= 2 x. ( 4 pCnt 2 ) = 0 ` . Since this is needed to show uniqueness for the real prime count function (over ` QQ ` ), we don't bother to define it off the primes. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Feb-2014.)
